singles.vanbancauhoi: A woman is talking about her house. What is she going to change in their house?
A receptionist is checking the client list of a clinic. How many clients are Americans?
Listen to Anna talking about her routine. Where does Anna go for a walk every morning?
Listen to a girl calling the cafe. What did she forget, and where did she leave it?
Helen is calling a friend about the place her whole family is standing while seeing her off to college. Where are they standing?
A tour guide is talking about the vacation list of activities. What can people do in the afternoon?
Doctor’s office is calling about a change in the appointment. When is the new appointment?
Alice is calling her friend. What did she lose?
The woman is calling a friend about meeting for dinner. How long does it take to get to the station?
Listen to a man talking about their train journey. What time did the train depart?
Listen to a woman asking about a flight. How much does the flight in the morning cost?
Listen to a friend talking about selling her music player. How much did she sell it for?
Listen to a woman explaining why he was late. What is the main reason he gets late?

multiples.title: Đề 2 - Listening 14
multiples.des: Listen to four people talking about doing exercises and answer the questions below.

lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: Person A: Exercise has become essential in my life, especially with my demanding and stressful job. The workload can be overwhelming at times, leaving me feeling exhausted and overwhelmed. That's why I turn to exercise as a way to unwind and rejuvenate. Whether it's going for a run, practicing yoga, or even just taking a brisk walk, exercise helps me release stress and clear my mind. I've noticed that after exercising, I feel more focused, energized, and ready to tackle my work with renewed vigor. It's incredible how something as simple as exercise can greatly improve my work performance and overall well-being.

Person B: 

Honestly? Exercise wears me out. The idea of getting all sweaty and sore doesn’t excite me at all. Every time I try to work out, it feels like I’m running on empty within minutes. And people say it gives them energy—are we talking about the same thing? I feel more tired just thinking about the treadmill! I know it’s supposed to be good for me, and I try to do it for my health, but I don’t get that rush people talk about. Exercise for me is just... exhausting. Why do something that makes me want to lie down for three days afterward?

Person C: 

"Exercising is a blast when you’re with the right people! I’ve joined a few group classes, and they’re like a party every time. The music is pumping, everyone’s in sync, and it feels like we’re all in this together. Working out alone can get boring, but with friends? You laugh, you encourage each other, and suddenly, an hour has flown by. We push each other, you know? It’s kind of amazing—half the time, I forget I’m even working out. I actually look forward to it. The camaraderie makes it worth every minute."

Person D: Exercise? Ugh, I can’t stand it. I know it’s supposed to be ‘good for you’ and all that, but I find it completely miserable. The sweat, the strain, the way my muscles burn afterward—it’s like a punishment. People say it’ll get better or that I’ll start to like it eventually, but I’ve tried, and I still hate it. Honestly, life’s too short to spend it doing something you can’t stand. There are other ways to be healthy that don’t involve torturing myself. I’d rather read a book than jog any day.

multiples.title: Đề 2 - Listening 15
multiples.des: Listen to two people discussing Politics. Read the opinions below and decide whose opinion matches the statements, the man, the woman, or both the man and the woman. You can listen to the discussion twice.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Young people are more into politics _
People are now better informed on politic. _

lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Woman: Politics have been a very common topic lately. I’ve noticed that young people are becoming much more interested in politics lately. It’s great to see them engaging in discussions and activism.

Man: I completely agree! It’s refreshing to see younger generations taking a stand on important issues.

Woman: I also think social media plays a big role in this. Platforms like Twitter and Instagram help spread political information quickly and connect people with similar interests.

Man: Actually I believe people are becoming better informed about politics not because of social media but through traditional news sources. Many are actively seeking information to understand the issues better.

Woman: I see your point, but I think social media has a unique impact. It allows for diverse voices to be heard that might not be represented in mainstream media.

Man: It’s also encouraging to see more women pursuing careers in politics. It brings different perspectives to the table, which is essential for a balanced approach to governance.

Woman: Absolutely! More representation is always a positive step forward.

multiples.title: Đề 2 - Listening 16
multiples.des: Listen to a writer talking about her experience in writing and choose the correct answer.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What does the writer believe helps her the most in her writing process?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Finding a quiet space to work

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What does the writer regret doing during her experience with writer's block?
lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Hi everyone! I’d like to share my experience with writer's block during the process of writing my new bestseller. Many people think that to write well, you need to sit down every day for 15 to 20 minutes or find a quiet space. While those strategies work for some, I’ve found that establishing specific time slots for writing that truly fit my style is what helps me the most.

However, I did face significant writer’s block at one point, and looking back, I regret not reaching out for guidance from others. I thought I could handle everything on my own, but sometimes it’s vital to get an outside perspective. Talking to fellow writers and mentors could have helped me overcome that block much faster. Now I understand that collaboration and sharing ideas can inspire creativity. So, if you ever find yourself stuck, don’t hesitate to reach out to others!

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Refuse to seek advice of others

multiples.title: Đề 2 - Listening 17
multiples.des: The radio is talking about a musician’s career and latest albums. Listen and choose the correct answer.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What has the musician decided regarding his singing career?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: He will retire from singing professionally
He will make a comeback after a long break
He will inform fans about new albums

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What could the musician have achieved with his recent albums?
lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Radio MC: Good afternoon, everyone! Today, we’re diving into the life of a beloved musician who has decided to retire from singing professionally. Unlike in the past, where he would inform his fans and then make a comeback, this time he’s serious about stepping away for good.

His talent has always shone through, and many believe he could have achieved even greater success with his recent albums. However, the long break he took between projects made it difficult for him to regain his previous momentum. Fans were excited to see him return, but the gap left some wondering if he could still capture the magic he once had.

As he prepares for this new chapter in his life, we can only reflect on the incredible music he’s given us over the years. He leaves behind a rich legacy that will inspire future generations of artists. Stay tuned for more updates on this iconic musician!

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: He could have been more successful
He could have inspired future generations in general.
He could have gotten a bigger fan base.

readings.title: Đề 2 - Reading part 1
readings.des:
Read the email from Henry to his friend, Mark. Choose one word from the list for each gap. The first one is done for you.

Dear Mark,
I just graduated (example) from university.
readings.des_cuoi:
We enjoy trying new recipes and cooking together.

It's a fun way to end the day!
See you,
Henry

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Now, I _ in a flat.
I _ it with my friend.
We are in the same _ at school.
We _ the car to work together.
In the evenings, we like to _ dinner.

readings.title: Đề 2 - Reading part 2
readings.des:
The sentences below are some instructions. Put the sentences in the right order.  The first sentence of the story is an example.

Set up a new printer

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: 0. To set up a new printer, follow these instructions

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Firstly, find an appropriate place to put the printer in.
When the printer is in place, turn it on by switching the buttons on the sides.
A light comes on at the front of the printer when the power is on.
If the light is green, the printer is ready to use.
Before using, remember to put some papers into the tray

readings.title: Đề 2 - Reading part 3
readings.des:
The sentences below are from some instructions. Put the sentences in the right order. The first sentence is done for you.

Visitors’ day at an animal hospital

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: 0. Please follow the instructions below to ensure you have a wonderful visit at our hospital.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: When you arrive, go straight to the main office to collect your ticket
You must show this to the member of staff before going to the hospital
Inside the building, you will see a photograph exhibition
Before you look at the picture, a guide will tell you about the day’s event
These activities include feeding and playing with the animals

readings.title: Đề 2 - Reading part 4
readings.des:
Four people respond to the interview on their attitude toward art. Read their interviews and answer the questions below.

Person A

I know the names of some famous artists, and I recognize some paintings. However, I only go to exhibitions when my friends want to. I find that seeing exhibitions is often boring, and while I appreciate the skill it takes to create art, I can’t help but feel that many galleries lack excitement. Despite this, I do have some artistic techniques myself; I enjoy painting in my free time, but I prefer to create rather than just observe.

Person B

I think that looking at art is a personal experience. I much prefer to see art on my own, where I can take my time to appreciate each piece without distractions. I think visitors to galleries should focus more on the art itself rather than chatting or using their phones. When I’m alone with a painting, I can truly connect with it and reflect on what the artist intended.

Person C

I find art fascinating. I have developed a good knowledge about various art movements and techniques over the years. Each piece tells a story, and I love discovering the history behind them. The colors, forms, and emotions captured in art pieces captivate my imagination. I could spend hours discussing and analyzing art, and I always look forward to learning more.

Person D

I have great memories associated with art, as I have been going to numerous art exhibitions in my whole life. I cherish the moments spent with friends and family, exploring galleries together. Seeing art with people close to me adds a special dimension to the experience; we share our thoughts and feelings about the pieces we encounter. These shared experiences have created lasting bonds and wonderful memories.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Who has  some artistic skills? _
Who prefers seeing art by themselves? _
Who has a good knowledge about art? _
Who thinks visitors to the galleries should focus more on the art? _
Who likes seeing art with others? _
Who has been going to art exhibitions all their life? _
Who thinks seeing an exhibition is boring? _

readings.title: Đề 2 - Reading part 5
readings.des:
Read the text. Match the headings to the paragraphs. There is one heading that you will not use.

Frozen Antarctica

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
1._

This continent is governed by an international agreement known as the Antarctic Treaty System, established in 1961. This treaty ensures that the region is utilized for peaceful purposes and encourages global scientific collaboration. While no nation officially owns this land, several countries—Argentina, Australia, Chile, France, New Zealand, Norway, and the United Kingdom—assert territorial claims. The treaty forbids military activity, resource extraction, and nuclear tests, designating the area for research and conservation efforts. As a result, scientists from various countries gather to study this unique environment, sharing their discoveries for the benefit of humanity.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Where is the end of the earth?

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
2. _ 
Setting foot on Antarctica is a significant event for any explorer or scientist. The journey typically begins in South America, where travelers board a ship or a plane to cross the Drake Passage. Once they arrive, the first step on the ice is both exhilarating and daunting. Visitors are immediately struck by the vast expanse of white, the crisp, cold air, and the breathtaking scenery. The sound of crunching ice underfoot serves as a reminder of the remote and untouched nature of this continent, a place where human footprints are few and far between.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Where is the end of the earth?

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
3. _ 
Positioned around the South Pole, Antarctica represents the southernmost point on the planet. The continent's remoteness contributes to its mystique, drawing adventurers and researchers alike. The harsh conditions, including bitter cold and relentless winds, create a sense of otherworldliness. In many ways, it feels like the last frontier on Earth, where the landscape remains largely unspoiled and the natural world thrives in its purest form

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Where is the end of the earth?

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
4. _

Beneath the massive ice sheets lies a concealed landscape that reveals much about the planet’s geological history. This region hosts the largest ice mass globally, covering approximately 98 percent of its area. The ice conceals a variety of geological features, including mountains and valleys. Researchers analyze ice cores extracted from deep within the layers to uncover details about past climates and atmospheric conditions. These investigations provide vital information for understanding global climate change and its potential implications for our world.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Where is the end of the earth?

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
5. _

The pursuit of the southernmost point in the early 20th century captivated many. Adventurers such as Robert Falcon Scott and Roald Amundsen undertook perilous journeys to achieve this milestone. Amundsen's successful expedition in 1911 marked a significant achievement in exploration, while Scott's tragic story underscored the risks associated with such endeavors. These tales of courage and ambition continue to inspire modern explorers, highlighting the fascination that this harsh terrain holds.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Where is the end of the earth?

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
6. _ 

Recent advancements in technology have made reaching this icy expanse easier than in the past. Modern icebreakers and advanced aircraft enable safer and more efficient travel. This accessibility has led to a rise in interest for tourism, allowing more people to experience the breathtaking beauty of the landscape. However, the increase in visitors raises concerns about the potential environmental impact, emphasizing the necessity for sustainable practices to safeguard this delicate ecosystem.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Where is the end of the earth?

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
7. _ 

The extreme low temperatures in this region result mainly from its high elevation and geographic positioning. Being located over the South Pole means it receives minimal direct sunlight, especially during the prolonged winter months of darkness. Average temperatures can plummet below -60°C (-76°F), with summer still remaining quite frigid. The reflective nature of ice further contributes to the chilling climate. Understanding these climatic influences is crucial for scientists studying global weather systems and shifts in climate patterns.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Where is the end of the earth?

speakings.title: Đề 2 - Speaking part 1
speakings.des:
In this part, I am going to ask you three short questions about yourself and your interests. You will have 30 seconds to reply to each question.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Please tell me about your favorite place.
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Version 1: My ideal place for resting is a small room with a cozy atmosphere and a comfy bed .It will be decorated with dim light, fluffy pillows and teddy bears. A bookshelf, where I can store my favorite books, will be good too. That's all I want to share and thank you for listening. 

Version 2: My favorite place is the park near my house. It’s a big park with lots of trees and a playground. I like to go there with my friends or family to relax or play sports. It’s a peaceful place, and I always feel happy when I’m there.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Please tell me about your favorite film star.
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Version 1: My favorite film star is Tom Holland. He is famous for playing Spider-Man in movies. I like him because he is a good actor and seems like a nice person. I enjoy watching his movies because they are exciting and fun to watch.

Version 2: I’d like to introduce Tom Holland, who I know from the Spider-man series. I have known him for 5 years from the movie End Game movie.To me he is a talented actor and I was moved by his acting. That's all I want to share and thank you for listening.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Please tell me about the last time you saw an advertisement.
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Version 1: When I was watching videos on Youtube, an advertisement appeared. As I remember, it was a Youtube advertisement , which recommended that I buy Premium Youtube to stop being interrupted from watching videos from advertisements. That's all I want to share and thank you for listening. 

Version 2:  The last time I saw an advertisement was yesterday. It was an ad for a new phone on TV. The phone had a big screen and many new features. The advertisement made it look very cool, and it made me want to buy it.

speakings.title: Đề 2 - Speaking part 3
speakings.des:
In this part, I'm going to ask you to compare two pictures, and I will then ask you two questions about them. You will have 45 seconds for each response.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Describe 2 pictures
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Both pictures show me about gardens. 

In the first picture, I can see 3 people, 1 man and 2 women. They are wearing casual clothes. It is clear that they are doing gardening, I guess they are planting trees. 

In the second picture, there are 2 girls and one grandfather. The grandfather is teaching his grandchildren to water plants.

I guess all of them are feeling happy because I can see the smile on their faces. 

Personally, I prefer the second picture because I think watering trees is easier than planting.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What are the attractions of the two pictures?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: Each picture has its own attractions. Regarding the first picture, a group of adults works together, planting in a garden, which shows how gardening can bring people closer. Turning to the second picture, I think gardening can be fun and educational for kids.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What is the appeal of growing plants and doing gardening?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: Growing plants and doing gardening is beneficial for various reasons. First, it is fun and interesting. Second, it is a wonderful way to expand social knowledge and gain more experience. Finally, it allows people to connect with nature and enjoy the beauty of plants and flowers.

speakings.title: Đề 2 - Speaking part 4
speakings.des:
In this part, I'm going to show you a picture and ask you three questions. You will have one minute to think about your answers before you start speaking. You will have two minutes to answer all three questions.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound. Look at the photograph.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
Describe a time when you visited someone.

What do you think about having unexpected visitors?

Some people like to live in small communities, while others like to live in big cities. What is your opinion?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Now, I am going to answer the 3 questions, which are: 
Describe a time when you visited someone.
What do you think about having unexpected visitors?
Some people like to live in small communities, while others like to live in big cities. What is your opinion?
Regarding the first question, let me tell you about a time that I visited someone  and it was when I wanted to make a trip to Danang City.
Well, Da Nang is famous for its beaches, and for example one of them is My Khe, which is one of the most wonderful beaches in the world, so every year, there are many tourists going to the area to see the beauty of the beach. Therefore, going to this city was extremely expensive for me at that time.
It was when I was a second-year student at university. At that time, I really wanted to take a trip to Danang city to visit my friend. After saving money for a long time, I finally decided to visit her in Danang city.
Turning to the second question, I think having unexpected visitors makes me feel very delighted.  
As for the final question, I prefer to live in small communities because it is more quiet and peaceful. Thanks to that, I can connect to nature.

speakings.title: Đề 2 - Speaking part 2
speakings.des:
In this part, I'm going to ask you to describe a picture. Then I will ask you two questions about it. You will have 45 seconds for each response.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Describe this picture
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
In the picture, I can see a dad and his son in the kitchen/ in the living room. 

In the background, I cannot see anything because it is so blurry. 

In the front, there is a man and his son eating breakfast on the table. 

It is clear that they are eating bread and drinking orange juice. 

I guess they are feeling happy. 

The picture is so beautiful that it was taken by a professional.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What do you eat for breakfast?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: This is an interesting question, let me answer it. For breakfast, I usually eat something simple and healthy. I often eat bread and sticky rice with my father for breakfast at home in the morning. It allows me to have enough energy for the whole day. That’s my answer.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Do you think people should eat breakfast?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: I agree that people should eat breakfast for various reasons. First, it is good for health because breakfast allows people to have enough energy for the whole day. Second, it is a good way to lower the risks of diseases, such as stomach ache. For me, I always eat fruit for breakfast every morning.

writings.title: Đề 2 - Writing part 1
writings.des:
You want to join a Computer club. You have 5 messages from a member of the club. Write short answers (1–5 words) to each message. Recommended time: 3 minutes.

Example How are you? I'm fine, thanks.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What is your favourite colour?
What is your favourite sport?
What is your favourite time of the year?
What do you like to do in the evening?
What is the weather like today?

writings.title: Đề 2 - Writing part 2
writings.des: You are a new member of the Computer club. Fill in the form. Write in sentences. Use 20–30 words. Recommended time: 7 minutes.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: When and where do you usually use a computer?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: I use a computer whenever I have free time, such as in the evening. Typically, I often use it at home for entertainment because it enables me to relax and reduce stress.

writings.title: Đề 2 - Writing part 3
writings.des: You are communicating with other members of the club in the chat room. Reply to their questions. Write in sentences. Use 30–40 words per answer. Recommended time: 10 minutes.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Kim: I love new technology. Can you please tell me about the last time you used a computer to do something?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: The last time I used a computer was yesterday when I searched for a tutorial video about cooking. I learned this skill with my family as ( = because) we are all interested in preparing meals for the family.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Marco: My grandmother doesn’t know anything  about computers? How can she learn about them? What should she do?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: I think she should start with basic online tutorials or enroll in beginner-friendly courses. Additionally, if I were you, I would teach her step by step patiently because she is old and needs thorough instructions to understand these high-tech devices.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Sylvia: Young people spend too much time using computers. Some say it is not good for them. What is your opinion?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: I agree with this opinion. It is harmful to young people to spend a large amount of time using computers. First, it may affect their physical health, for example, they can be subject to obesity. Second, spending too much time on computers can lead to mental health conditions, causing heightened.

writings.title: Đề 2 - Writing part 4
writings.des:
You are a member of the Computer Club. You received this email from the club’s manager.

Dear members,

We are making some changes to the website because we want more people to join us. As you know, the website at the moment is very simple and we would be interested to hear some ideas about ways to make it more attractive and why you think it would attract more visitors.

Bests,
Club Mananger.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Write an email to your friend, who is also a member of this club. Tell your friend about your opinion and why. Write about 50 words

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi:
Hi Tom,
Have you received the email from our club?
I am very delighted to hear that news.
I think that we should follow a certain concept with a theme, many beautiful pictures. Besides, it is advisable that we add some stories of our members
What do you think about this? Hope to hear from you soon.
John

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Write an email to the manager of the club. Tell the manager about your opinion and why. Write about 120-150 words.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi:
Dear Club Manager,
My name is Henry. I have been a member of our club for 2 months.
I am writing in response to your latest email.
According to the news, our club plans to add some alterations(=changes) to the website to attract more new members. 
To be honest, I am very delighted to hear that news.
I would love to venture my idea. I think we should introduce more well-illustrated images into the websites, which could enhance the website's appeal. Besides, it is advisable to include some inspirational stories from successful members.This is because these stories could serve as powerful evidence, (which showcases)/ showcasing the positive impact of our club. By implementing these new strategies, the experience of our visitors can be improved. As a result, we can attract more people to join our club. 
I hope my suggestions will be useful.
I am looking forward to hearing from you soon.
Best regards,
Henry.
